slang.name: ACPA:
slang.description: Assisted Combat Personell Armor aka Power Armor.

slang.name: Amped Out:
slang.description: Fatigue after being under the influence of combat drugs.

slang.name: AV/Aerodynes:
slang.description: Aerovehicles and aerodynes are flying cars.

slang.name: Bag man:
slang.description: Fixers who orchestrate deals with mercenaries.

slang.name: Borgs / Full body conversations:
slang.description: People who have opted to replace most of their body with cybernetic conversions.

slang.name: Badges:
slang.description: Slang for the Night City Police Department (NCPD).

slang.name: Big hats:
slang.description: State police men.

slang.name: Bioware:
slang.description: Body enhancements that are based around biology instead of electronics.

slang.name: Body Sculpting:
slang.description: Altering your appearance through cosmetic surgery and cybernetics.

slang.name: Body banks:
slang.description: Medical centers that store, preserve and grow body parts.

slang.name: Boosters:
slang.description: Boostergang members who use cyberware, leather jackets and has an affinity for violence.

slang.name: Braindance:
slang.description: A type of recorded immmersive virtual reality where you feel all sensations of the recorder.

slang.name: Brain Potato:
slang.description: Braindance addicts.

slang.name: Button head:
slang.description: Addicts who stimulate their brain through interface sockets.

slang.name: Cams:
slang.description: Braindance recordings.

slang.name: Call girls:
slang.description: High-priced prositutes.

slang.name: Choomba / Choombatta:
slang.description: Neo-African slang for friend/family member.

slang.name: Chippin' in:
slang.description: Getting your first cyberware.

slang.name: Chairjocks:
slang.description: Netrunner.

slang.name: CHOOH2:
slang.description: Superfuel of the future engineered by Biotechnica and licensed by Petrochem.

slang.name: Chrome:
slang.description: Cyberware

slang.name: Chromed out:
slang.description: Being full of Cyberware.

slang.name: Chrome bangers:
slang.description: Slang for the C-SWAT aka Cyberpsycho Squad / MAX-TAC who take down and kill Cyberpsychos.

slang.name: Combat drugs:
slang.description: Designer drugs created to make you into a killer.

slang.name: Combat zone:
slang.description: Places of urban decay in cities characterized by high crime, violence and tattered infrastructure.

slang.name: Credchip / Chop:
slang.description: A chip with eurodollars.

slang.name: Crystal Jock:
slang.description: Netrunner.

slang.name: Cyberpsychos:
slang.description: Individuals who are mentally ill due to excessive cyberware implants.

slang.name: Cyberdeck:
slang.description: A hardware device required for you to enter Cyberspace aka The Net.

slang.name: Data Fortress:
slang.description: 3D Representation of a computer system on the net. Usually looks like something out of Tron.

slang.name: Dataterm:
slang.description: Public information access computers placed in heavily armored cases on most US street corners.

slang.name: Dirtgirl / Dirtboy:
slang.description: Orbital slang for earthmen and women.

slang.name: Dock:
slang.description: Intercourse.

slang.name: Dragon Piss:
slang.description: Any form of oriental beer.

slang.name: Dream time:
slang.description: Being jailed and confined inside a braindance.

slang.name: Eddies:
slang.description: Eurodollars / Eurobucks.

slang.name: Edgerunners:
slang.description: People living on The Edge.

slang.name: Eurobucks:
slang.description: Other word for Eurodollars.

slang.name: Eurodollars:
slang.description: The european currency unit, which is one of the most used currencies in Night City and all over the world.

slang.name: Exotics:
slang.description: Biosculpted individuals who typically have non-human features like fur, fangs and/or tails.

slang.name: Face:
slang.description: Interface or jacking into the net.

slang.name: Flatbacker:
slang.description: A prostitute.

slang.name: Flatline:
slang.description: To kill.

slang.name: Fixers:
slang.description: Information brokers and a class. Make deals and facilitates mercenaries.

slang.name: Fodder:
slang.description: Derogatory term for the Solo class.

slang.name: Gonks:
slang.description: Idiots.

slang.name: Gonked out:
slang.description: Broken/Defective.

slang.name: Handle:
slang.description: Your working name on the street.

slang.name: Hexed:
slang.description: Cyberpsychosis or obsessed with the net.

slang.name: Hotdoggers:
slang.description: Inexperienced netrunners.

slang.name: Hosho Kaisha:
slang.description: Japanese slang for hired muscle.

slang.name: I.C.E:
slang.description: Intrusion Countermeasure Electronics.

slang.name: Input:
slang.description: Girlfriend.

slang.name: Joygirl/boys:
slang.description: Prostitutes who have been sculpted to meet the user.

slang.name: Kibble:
slang.description: Cheaply produced food that resemble cat/dog food.

slang.name: Linefoot:
slang.description: Nomad slang for anyone who isn't a nomad.

slang.name: Meat Puppets:
slang.description: Prostitutes who are connected to brain dances while being banged.

slang.name: Metal Head:
slang.description: People undergone full cyborg conversion.

slang.name: Mizu Shobai:
slang.description: Water industries like nightclubs, bars, resturants.

slang.name: Monkey:
slang.description: ACPA user who isn't well trained.

slang.name: NCART:
slang.description: Night City Area Rapid Transit aka monorail train system.

slang.name: Netwatch:
slang.description: Policing organization looking in The Net for illegal activities. They use programs to kill or maim opposition.

slang.name: Netpig:
slang.description: Derogatory term for Netwatch.

slang.name: Nudies:
slang.description: People without power armor or exoskeletons.

slang.name: Output:
slang.description: Boyfriend.

slang.name: Paintboys:
slang.description: Yakuza

slang.name: Pastaboys:
slang.description: Italian Mafia.

slang.name: Panzerboys:
slang.description: Smugglers.

slang.name: Polymer-One shots:
slang.description: Cheap unreliable non-reloadable handguns.

slang.name: Posergangs:
slang.description: A gang that sculpe their body to look a certain way.

slang.name: Psychogang:
slang.description: A combat gang that is very near cyberpsychosis.

slang.name: Puppets:
slang.description: Gang members who have sold out to the corpos or organized crime syndicates.

slang.name: Reality junkies:
slang.description: Addicts to Virtual Reality, braindance, The Net or video games.

slang.name: Ripperdocs:
slang.description: Surgeons who specialize in installing Cyberware.

slang.name: Rin Tin Tin:
slang.description: A robot dog, usually a police K9.

slang.name: Ronins:
slang.description: Freelance mercenaries.

slang.name: Samurai:
slang.description: Corporate assassin or mercenary, hired to hit corporate property or make strikes against other corpo holdings.

slang.name: Screamsheets:
slang.description: Newspapers that can be printed at Dataterms.

slang.name: Shards:
slang.description: Cyberchips that store programs.

slang.name: Skagman:
slang.description: Wired illegal seller.

slang.name: Spook:
slang.description: An intelligence or espionage agent

slang.name: Taking sake:
slang.description: Working for Japanese organizations or crime syndicates.

slang.name: Tiger:
slang.description: Military netrunner.

slang.name: Throwbacks:
slang.description: Another word for Exotics.

slang.name: Vatjobs:
slang.description: People with excessive cyberware replacements.

slang.name: Wilson:
slang.description: A screwup.

slang.name: Zipgun:
